label: [eventhandler] register and unregister handler
info: ## gen_event behaviour Simple example of defining a module that should act as an event handler. That handler is added and removed with no errors. This demonstrates the implementation of the the [`gen_event`](https://www.erlang.org/doc/apps/stdlib/gen_event.html) behaviour in Erlang-Red. It does this by defining a module that handles the events. As many modules and handlers as necessary can be defined. ## Setup First a event_handler_fubar module is defined for handling events sent to the Event Handler. The handler defined in the module is dynamically assigned to the event handler via the add handler event_handler_test_one action. The module is defined when the flow is loaded, the event handler is added once the flow begins execution in Erlang-Red. So even though the module is defined here, it is loaded before the flow begins execution. Having installed the module as a handler, an event of type fubar is generated to ensure the handler is triggered. After the event has been handled, the handler is removed by a remove handler event_handler_test_one message. ## This is a flow test Because this is a flow test, the delay nodes have been added. The assert nodes ensure the test is working. During the testing, all inject nodes are triggered at once, therefore the delays ensure a specific order of messages. ## Other behaviours - [Supervisor](https://flows.red-erik.org/f/83c5e1824f32abec) - [State machine](https://flows.red-erik.org/f/5672fa442b2b881d)

name: event_handler_fubar
code:
-module(event_handler_fubar).

-behaviour(gen_event).

-export([
    init/1,
    handle_event/2,
    handle_call/2,
    handle_info/2,
    terminate/2,
    code_change/3
]).

-import(ered_nodes, [
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes/2
]).

-import(ered_msgtracer_helpers, [
    send_off_debug/2
]).

init(Args) ->
    {ok, Args}.

handle_event({<<"event_type_fubar">>, Msg, NodeDef}, State) ->
    Msg2 = Msg#{ <<"handled">> => <<"Fubar Event">> },
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes(NodeDef, Msg2),
    {ok, State};

handle_event(_Event, State) ->
    {ok, State}.

handle_call(_Request, State) ->
    {ok, ok, State}.

handle_info(_Info, State) ->
    {ok, State}.

terminate(_Reason, _State) ->
    ok.

code_change(_OldVsn, State, _Extra) ->
    {ok, State}.
